パロディや二次創作も多く、レビューも軽快で、楽し気なゲームかなあ、と軽い気持ちで購入しました。
→ホラーじゃないですか……やだあ……ケーキはまだですか……
　――ここで体感数か月詰む――
→あっ、もしかして、ここからこうやって先に進めるんじゃね？
　――進んだ先からまた詰む――　<ホラーだよ
→開発者による解説を一通り目を通す
→ホラーじゃないじゃないですかー！　やたー！
→謎解きめ！　アクションめ！　こうしてまとめてポイじゃ！
　　　　　　　　ケーキがなんじゃい！

結論：開発者による解説は強い味方


　開発者による解説が強い味方でした。理不尽やSF的なホラーや、謎解きの方法を忘れたり、その他なんやかんやに押しつぶされそうになって、先に進めなくなったら、もったいぶらずに聞きに行くといいと思います。美術館の音声案内のような感じです。人の丁寧な優しさでゲームデザインがなされていることがわかって、安心します（やっぱり無機質な空間に人の声が流れるだけで安心）。

　もともと3D酔いしやすい体質なので、SF的ホラーな雰囲気も相まって酔いやすいゲームでした。しかし酔うのも気にならないくらいに知的好奇心を刺激されて続けられたので、酔うほうだけどゲームは気になるなあ……という方はぜひやってみてください。

Excelente jogo que sempre está em promoção por um preço justo. No geral ele é bem fácil e bem curto, mas se você assim como eu, gosta platinar os jogos prepare-se pois nesse aqui você dará muitos rages para conseguir as medalhas de ouro nos desafios.
牛逼

Portal has received extreme acclaim during it's 14 years of release, to a point where it appeals to a wide degree of gamers due to it's fun Sci-Fi puzzle platformer/puzzle based gameplay that even bests other Valve franchises to some degree like 
Half Life (the precursor for the foundation of the spin off on Portal), Left for Dead, Counter Strike, etc. 

And after playing the game, it's very apparent why that is the case.

You start as a player named Chell residing in the Aperture Science Laboratories, (Black Mesa's rival science research lab) for an undisclosed amount of time.

Then a A.I robot named  GLaDOS apparently promises her cake if she completes her tests in certain science chambers around the Aperture Laboratories.

And then slowly you get the weapon that makes so fun and the genuine good platforming that it's based around, the portal gun.

Granted you don't get the ability to shoot both portals right away, but you do quickly earn them regardless and when you do it will be the most fun you will ever have in a puzzle game.

That's because the platforming that's built around the portal gun is fine tuned to work with each other to feel like quality stuff that hooks you of it's ability to have the curiosity lached  onto it in terms of thoughts on what you can do with the portal gun with on how you can manipulate the physics and the surroundings to do pretty neat stuff with it.

For example, Chell can use her portal gun to shoot 1 portal up and another down to then build up the momentum by going in a loop de loop that propels her up to her destination.

Another example would be to manipulate your outside surroundings and to move it by determining where it should go to reach the generator, and by all means this is fun not counting the other forms and variants of said puzzle solving/platforming.

In a way it's vastly superior to Half Life's 1 platforming because while that game is still very good it's a bit dated due to how they designed it back then, like having to crouch across a tiny nudge to move or even having to deal with some monotonous BS like having to avoid a spinning fan to the point where i'd say it's just not fun platforming at that point.

Portal avoids this and ages better because of the way they orchestrated the platforming by removing all tedious nonsense like small unnoticeable crevices and just focuses on the large area that they have and around, *again the portal gun that remains fun to use even after 14 years later.

Aside from the solid platforming & gameplay the atmosphere and sci-fi lore feels questioning and unnerving with the thoughts of the player on, "Is this place abandoned?" "Am I the only person here?" 
"Is GLaDOS helpful or an insane A.I robot gone rouge?" "What if i'm not alone in the laboratory?" 
"What is life on the outside like"?

Questions like these help in mystifying the atmosphere that still makes it pretty interesting to talk about this day because again, it's fun with coming up with theory's and speculation into some of these questions due to the everlasting curiosity behind it, it's supposed to make you think, care and immerse you into the world building that portal is trying to set.

Along with visual drawings like "The Cake is a Lie!" that makes you think on what if GLaDOS is a lier and if she has malicious intentions beyond not promising Chell cake.

At that Valve did a damn good job in my book along with Half Life 1, a spin off set in the same universe which released 9 years prior to portal in 1998.

Overall Portal is a game that's captured the hearts and minds of millions due to it's unique gameplay that feels fresh even after it's humble beginning in the Orange box at 2007.

While my mind and thoughts might change and evolve with the critiques as I re-play the game in the future, for now in the present I rate Portal a Solid 4/5 game that's aged really well and is worth playing today along with proving that you don't have to be new in order to be good.

And the best thing is that with Portal 1 you don't need to know the extensive lore of the Half Life series necessary and is extremely optimized for any high or low end PC hardware with it being a 14 year old game.
